channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Do you have a lottery addiction? With the Powerball jackpot now at $643 million, this man’s story may be telling.
item.description: Adam Osmond gambled away a fortune on lottery games, but eventually sought help.

item.title: Target hires a veteran as its new CEO, as it tries to turn itself around. Some say the move lacks ‘pop.’
item.description: Analysts say incoming CEO Michael Fiddelke “deserves a chance to prove himself,” though it could take time and more money for Target to get its charm ...

item.title: I’m 65 and started saving at 23. Do I buy an annuity to protect against diminished Social Security?
item.description: “I will be comfortable spending $250,000 annually on more than $4 million in investments.”

item.title: Estée Lauder approves 3,200 job cuts as China and duty-free sales remain weak
item.description: Estée Lauder Cos.’ stock dropped about 5% Wednesday after the maker of beauty products warned of a full-year profit miss and said it has approved 3,20...

item.title: Carvana’s stock is falling, and Amazon is to blame
item.description: Hertz and Amazon’s used-car partnership touts convenience, which strikes at the heart of Carvana’s business model.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
